Australia: The Overland Telegraph Line linking Darwin and Adelaide opened.
Brazil:
In the aftermath of the Paraguayan War, the new government of Paraguay makes peace with Brazil, grants reparations and territorial concessions.
Brazil conducts its first official census, the population is 9,930,478.
Colombia: Manuel Murillo Toro is President of the United States of Colombia for second time
Germany: Kulturkampf: The School Supervision Act was passed, transferring all religious schools to state control.
Philippine: About 200 Filipinos stage a mutiny in Cavite.
Priests Mariano Gomez, Jos√© Apolonio Burgos, and Jacinto Zamora (together known as Gomburza) are implicated in the Cavite Mutiny and executed.
